definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: The frequency equilibrium is a particular case of the stable equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 频率平衡是稳定平衡的特例。

sentences.english: But the study says the United States was an important exception -- at least so far.
sentences.chinese: 但该研究称，美国是一个特例，至少目前为止是如此。

sentences.english: Is Rollie an exception, or are all gorillas as clever?
sentences.chinese: 罗妮是个特例，还是所有的大猩猩都一样聪明？

sentences.english: And Caroline Hurford says Congo is not alone.
sentences.chinese: 然而赫福德表示，刚果并非特例。

sentences.english: Scalpers pour goods, be not is a special case of the electric business online.
sentences.chinese: “黄牛”倒货，并非是线上电商的特例。

sentences.english: Specific examples include erythromycin and enterobactin biosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 特例包括红霉素和肠菌素的生物合成。

sentences.english: We can take a very special case, and we can take m2 going to infinity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有个特例，我们使m2无限大。

sentences.english: The only exception is Giffen's paradox .
sentences.chinese: 唯一的特例是吉芬悖论。

sentences.english: Personality type is common practice and is a special case.
sentences.chinese: 类型是常例而个性是特例。

sentences.english: A special case of dynamic routing is content-based routing.
sentences.chinese: 动态路由的一个特例就是基于内容的路由。

sentences.english: We also tend to aver age things, ignoring special cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们也倾向于归纳一般情况，忽略特例情况。

sentences.english: This instance of gene-culture interaction turns out to be far from unique.
sentences.chinese: 这个基因与文化互动的例子最终被证明并非特例。

sentences.english: La Xida eye bleeding that is probably a special case.
sentences.chinese: 那个眼睛流血的拉西达，恐怕是个特例。

sentences.english: The straight rod and the planar ring are two special cases of helix.
sentences.chinese: 直杆和圆环杆为螺旋线状态的两种特例。

sentences.english: However, in Deuteronomy , there were exceptions to this prohibition of intermarriage.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在《申命记》里，也有关于允许通婚的特例。

sentences.english: Is Oregon's metropolis a leader among American cities or just strange?
sentences.chinese: 俄勒冈重镇是领美国城市之先河，或者仅是个特例？

definition: as far as I know/to the best of my knowledge
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
according to reason/in the ordinary course of events/normally
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
